channel.title: BigDataCon on Inductive Bias
channel.description: Recent content in BigDataCon on Inductive Bias

item.title: JAX: Hadoop overview by Bernd Fondermann
item.description: JAX: Hadoop overview by Bernd Fondermann # After breakfast was over the first day started with a talk by Bernd on the Hadoop ecosystem. He did a good job selecting the most important and interesting projects related to storing data in HDFS and processing it with Map Reduce. After the usual "what is Hadoop", "what does the general architecture look like", "what will change with YARN" Bernd gave a nice overview of which

item.title: BigDataCon
item.description: BigDataCon # Together with Uwe Schindler I had published a series of articles on Apache Lucene at Software and Support Media's Java Mag several years ago. Earlier this year S&S kindly invited my to their BigDataCon - co-located with JAX to give a talk of my choosing that at least touches upon Lucene. Thinking back and forth about what topic to cover what came to my mind was to
